Information About Light and Solar Lights

The citizens are requested to classify household waste in the form of wet and dry garbage. Wet waste should be collected in green and dry garbage in blue trash and thus the classified waste should be handed over to the cleaner.

Dry waste is polyethylene bags, plastic goods, iron goods, torn clothes, newspaper trash, paper, cardboard, rappers, etc., which can be disposed of through the disposal of the wreckage.

Wet Waste is the waste which includes stale food, spoiled fruit, leafy vegetables, egg shells, tea powder, waterproofing of plants, which are destroyed by nature, etc.

To make dangerous waste like hay waste, dry trash and glass to be binding, and to impose a furore on those who do not; Such instructions have been made to the Central Government by the Parliamentary Committee appointed for the management of waste. The report submitted by the committee said that the government should take initiative to restrict the garbage collection by encouraging the waste to be kept separate.

Development of water resources such as removal of sludge in village pond, removal of sludge in wells, recharge of well, water tank construction and repair, installation of bore well / hand pumps and maintenance etc. are included in village development plan.

Repairing of water supply related equipment such as connecting and repair of pipelines for water, borewell / hand pump / drainage of wells, and water tanker facilities etc.

In this plan, the provision is made to supply water to the village through solar pumps where electricity supply is not available.

In order to provide clean drinking water provisions like, the use of RO technology or water purification project to maintain the drinking water supply in villages, to set up water meter devices to avoid water abuse, and to expand the water supply schemes for economically weaker sections are made in village development plan.

Not having a system of street light on rural roads is a serious problem. With absence of street light there are problems like social insecurity, crime etc. Keeping all this in mind, priority has been given on the issue of establishing and maintaining a street light in the development plan.\n\nThe provision is made in the development plan for the use of L E D / Solar Lamps and their annual maintenance.

Since most of the rural areas lack basic infrastructure such as Gram Panchayat building, proper furniture, etc., the result is lack of efficiency in the Gram Panchayat and other administrative offices. Given the seriousness of all these issues, priority has been given in the rural development plan on the development and maintenance of infrastructure for the Gram Panchayat.

The provision is made in the development plan, to maintain necessary amendments to the various properties of the Gram Panchayat created under the Gram Panchayat area

Building gram panchayat building where there is no Gram Panchayat building, or expanding the Gram Panchayat Bhavan, necessary furniture for the Gram Panchayat building, building for anganwadi etc. are included in village development plan.
The introduction of Shri Chandrashekhar Bawankule, the Honorable Guardian Minister of Nagpur District

Mr. Chandrashekhar Bawankule was born and a farmer family with a non-political background. His education and higher education took place at Koradi near Nagpur. With the objective of selfless social service, he established "Chhatrapati Sena" and till 1994 he was active in social services. Later, he joined the Bharatiya Janata Party in 1995 under the leadership of late Gopinath Munde and Nitin Gadkari. In 1995, he served as the Vice President of the Bhartiya Janta Yuva Morcha. In 1997 and 2002, Mr. Chandrashekhar Bawankul was elected as a member of the Zilla Parishad. In 2004, he was elected to the state assembly. They are currently working for the third time as the legislator till 2014. On December 6, 2014, Bawankule was sworn in as Energy, New and Renewable Energy Minister by BJP. Shri Chandrasekhar Bavankule is also working as Nagpur's District Guardian Minister. They have a lion's share in the development of Mahadula. All the development works have been implemented in Mahadula Nagar area under their leadership. That is why Shri Chandrashekhar Bawankul is a very popular and respected leader.
